trans-unit.source: Test Plans

seg-source.mrk: Test Plans

trans-unit.source: Test Plans are the templates for a test order to be carried out during or afterwards the item or lot has been received on stock and has gone into quarantine. The Test Plan uses the defined Test Property Sets and Test Devices.

seg-source.mrk: Test Plans are the templates for a test order to be carried out during or afterwards the item or lot has been received on stock and has gone into quarantine.
The Test Plan uses the defined Test Property Sets and Test Devices.

trans-unit.source: Test Plans can be created item-specific. Either they are related to an item via the Item Card or via the related routing. That means a Test Plan must be allocated to each item that is to be tested.

seg-source.mrk: Test Plans can be created item-specific.
Either they are related to an item via the Item Card or via the related routing.
That means a Test Plan must be allocated to each item that is to be tested.

trans-unit.source: : Test Plan Card

seg-source.mrk: : Test Plan Card

trans-unit.source: In the header of the Test Plan template there is general information regarding the Test Plan. In the lines of the template the selected Test Property Sets are listed or are managed.

seg-source.mrk: In the header of the Test Plan template there is general information regarding the Test Plan.
In the lines of the template the selected Test Property Sets are listed or are managed.

trans-unit.source: General FastTab

seg-source.mrk: General FastTab

trans-unit.source: The fields on the General FastTab are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on the General FastTab are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field

seg-source.mrk: Field

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: No.

seg-source.mrk: No.

trans-unit.source: Unique identifier from the number series or manually entered if manual numbering is allowed.

seg-source.mrk: Unique identifier from the number series or manually entered if manual numbering is allowed.

trans-unit.source: Version

seg-source.mrk: Version

trans-unit.source: Current version of the test plan. Since Test Plans are versioned, when a Test Plan is certified, it starts with version 1. It is allocated automatically by the system and serially numbered through.

seg-source.mrk: Current version of the test plan.
Since Test Plans are versioned, when a Test Plan is certified, it starts with version 1.
It is allocated automatically by the system and serially numbered through.

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Description of the test plan.

seg-source.mrk: Description of the test plan.

trans-unit.source: Document Type / External Document Path

seg-source.mrk: Document Type / External Document Path

trans-unit.source: Indicates if the Test Plan is within Microsoft Dynamics NAV (Integrated Document) or if the test is related to an External Document.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates if the Test Plan is within Microsoft Dynamics NAV (Integrated Document) or if the test is related to an External Document.

trans-unit.source: For Test Plans with an External Document, a mapping (data link) can be entered in the External Document Path field to indicate where the document is stored.

seg-source.mrk: For Test Plans with an External Document, a mapping (data link) can be entered in the External Document Path field to indicate where the document is stored.

trans-unit.source: Status

seg-source.mrk: Status

trans-unit.source: Current state of the Test Plan. The options are New, Certified, Under Development and Closed.

seg-source.mrk: Current state of the Test Plan.
The options are New, Certified, Under Development and Closed.

trans-unit.source: New Test Plans are set with the New status. Test Plans that are not certified cannot be used or selected for test orders.

seg-source.mrk: New Test Plans are set with the New status.
Test Plans that are not certified cannot be used or selected for test orders.

trans-unit.source: Type

seg-source.mrk: Type

trans-unit.source: Specifies if the test plan is related to an Item or a Test Device.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies if the test plan is related to an Item or a Test Device.

trans-unit.source: Valid from / Valid to

seg-source.mrk: Valid from / Valid to

trans-unit.source: Specifies in which period the test plan can be used. If a test plan has expired and is connected to an item, the system will return a message upon posting of the receivable.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies in which period the test plan can be used.
If a test plan has expired and is connected to an item, the system will return a message upon posting of the receivable.

trans-unit.source: Default

seg-source.mrk: Default

trans-unit.source: Indicates if the testing has been defined internally or if it should be executed based on an external request (for example, testing according to the technical supervision society).

seg-source.mrk: Indicates if the testing has been defined internally or if it should be executed based on an external request (for example, testing according to the technical supervision society).

trans-unit.source: De.-/Certification Date / De.-/Certified by

seg-source.mrk: De.-/Certification Date / De.-/Certified by

trans-unit.source: Date and User ID of when certification status changes.

seg-source.mrk: Date and User ID of when certification status changes.

trans-unit.source: Responsibility Center

seg-source.mrk: Responsibility Center

trans-unit.source: Responsibility Center that is allocated to the test plan.

seg-source.mrk: Responsibility Center that is allocated to the test plan.

trans-unit.source: Ready for Certification

seg-source.mrk: Ready for Certification

trans-unit.source: Automatically selected when the status is changed to Certified.

seg-source.mrk: Automatically selected when the status is changed to Certified.

trans-unit.source: Lines FastTab

seg-source.mrk: Lines FastTab

trans-unit.source: In the Lines FastTab, the Test Property Sets are allocated to the Test Plan. The pre-selected test values from the Test Property Sets are also copied. It is possible to change certain editable fields of the copied Test Property Sets and criteria. This may be necessary if some of the expected test results have to be changed to fit the related item or routing.

seg-source.mrk: In the Lines FastTab, the Test Property Sets are allocated to the Test Plan.
The pre-selected test values from the Test Property Sets are also copied.
It is possible to change certain editable fields of the copied Test Property Sets and criteria.
This may be necessary if some of the expected test results have to be changed to fit the related item or routing.

trans-unit.source: Test Plan Property Set Card

seg-source.mrk: Test Plan Property Set Card

trans-unit.source: On the Lines FastTab, click Property Set > Card to open the Test Plan Prop. Set Card for a line. For Test Properties that have a Testing Method of Counting (AQL), specific properties can be tested in a given interval of test quantity. Use the “Choose Columns” function in the Test Plan Prop. Set Card page to show the Test Each (Times) field.

seg-source.mrk: On the Lines FastTab, click Property Set > Card to open the Test Plan Prop.
Set Card for a line.
For Test Properties that have a Testing Method of Counting (AQL), specific properties can be tested in a given interval of test quantity.
Use the “Choose Columns” function in the <span class="Bold">Test Plan Prop.
Set Card page to show the Test Each (Times) field.

trans-unit.source: : Test Plan Prop. Set Card page for Testing Method = Counting (AQL)

seg-source.mrk: : Test Plan Prop.
Set Card page for Testing Method = Counting (AQL)

trans-unit.source: The Test Activity No. field is used to assign a predefined activity to an individual Test Plan Property Set line and specifies how long it takes to perform testing of this property. For more information about Test Order Scheduling, refer to topic “Test Order Scheduling” on page 1.

seg-source.mrk: The Test Activity No.
field is used to assign a predefined activity to an individual Test Plan Property Set line and specifies how long it takes to perform testing of this property.

For more information about Test Order Scheduling, refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Test Order Scheduling.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Test Order Scheduling” on page 1</MadCap:xref>.

trans-unit.source: The information entered in the Test Each (Times) field determines whether the lot- or serial number has to be tested or not. For example, if this field is set to 3 on the Scratch test property, scratches will be tested on the first and then again on the fourth test.

seg-source.mrk: The information entered in the Test Each (Times) field determines whether the lot- or serial number has to be tested or not.
For example, if this field is set to 3 on the Scratch test property, scratches will be tested on the first and then again on the fourth test.

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: The Test Each (Times) field cannot be populated if an Inspection Severity Code is entered on the Item Test Prop. Insp. Severities page (refer to topic “Inspection Severities of Test Properties” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: The Test Each (Times) field cannot be populated if an Inspection Severity Code is entered on the Item Test Prop.
Insp.
Severities page (refer to topic “Inspection Severities of Test Properties” on page 1).

trans-unit.source: Interpret Determined Value

seg-source.mrk: Interpret Determined Value

trans-unit.source: In the Value Recording process, the interpretation of the Determined Value can be managed in two ways. The most critical aspect for interpretation is the Expected Value in combination with Upper Limit and/or Lower Limit. If Expected Value is between these limits, but not relevant to accept Determined Value as valid, then the “Use Without Expected Value” feature has to be activated. If not activated, the system will interpret Expected Value as limit itself.

seg-source.mrk: In the Value Recording process, the interpretation of the Determined Value can be managed in two ways.
The most critical aspect for interpretation is the Expected Value in combination with Upper Limit and/or Lower Limit.
If Expected Value is between these limits, but not relevant to accept Determined Value as valid, then the “Use Without Expected Value” feature has to be activated.
If not activated, the system will interpret Expected Value as limit itself.

trans-unit.source: : Various Expected Values, Upper/Lower Limits set in a Test Plan Prop.Set Card

seg-source.mrk: : Various Expected Values, Upper/Lower Limits set in a Test Plan Prop.Set Card

trans-unit.source: In the Quality Management Setup page, selecting the Use Without Expected Value check box calculates the Valid Determined Value field in the Value Recording process based on the Upper Limit and/or Lower Limit fields and therefore, the value in the Expected Value field is not considered.

seg-source.mrk: In the Quality Management Setup page, selecting the Use Without Expected Value check box calculates the Valid Determined Value field in the Value Recording process based on the Upper Limit and/or Lower Limit fields and therefore, the value in the Expected Value field is not considered.

trans-unit.source: : Use Without Expected Value in Quality Management Setup

seg-source.mrk: : Use Without Expected Value in Quality Management Setup

trans-unit.source: The following table shows how the system decides if the Determined Value is valid based on empty Upper/Lower Limits.

seg-source.mrk: The following table shows how the system decides if the Determined Value is valid based on empty Upper/Lower Limits.

trans-unit.source: Use Without Expected Value

seg-source.mrk: Use Without Expected Value

trans-unit.source: Example Settings

seg-source.mrk: Example Settings

trans-unit.source: Results

seg-source.mrk: Results

trans-unit.source: No

seg-source.mrk: No

trans-unit.source:
Lower Limit = 5
Upper Limit = ‘’
Expected Value = 10

seg-source.mrk: Lower Limit = 5
Upper Limit = ‘’
Expected Value = 10

trans-unit.source: System replaces the Upper Limit with the Expected Value; then creates a range from 5 to 10 to decide if the Determined Value is valid.

seg-source.mrk: System replaces the Upper Limit with the Expected Value; then creates a range from 5 to 10 to decide if the Determined Value is valid.

trans-unit.source:
Lower Limit = ‘’
Upper Limit = 20
Expected Value = 12

seg-source.mrk: Lower Limit = ‘’
Upper Limit = 20
Expected Value = 12

trans-unit.source: System replaces the Lower Limit with the Expected Value; then creates a range from 12 to 20 to decide if the Determined Value is valid.

seg-source.mrk: System replaces the Lower Limit with the Expected Value; then creates a range from 12 to 20 to decide if the Determined Value is valid.

trans-unit.source: Yes

seg-source.mrk: Yes

trans-unit.source:
Lower Limit = 5
Upper Limit = ‘’
Expected Value = 10

seg-source.mrk: Lower Limit = 5
Upper Limit = ‘’
Expected Value = 10

trans-unit.source: System uses the Lower Limit an ignores the Expected Value; then creates a range from 5 (5..) to decide if the Determined Value is valid.

seg-source.mrk: System uses the Lower Limit an ignores the Expected Value; then creates a range from 5 (5..) to decide if the Determined Value is valid.

trans-unit.source:
Lower Limit = ‘’
Upper Limit = 20
Expected Value = 12

seg-source.mrk: Lower Limit = ‘’
Upper Limit = 20
Expected Value = 12

trans-unit.source: System uses the Upper Limit an ignores the Expected Value; then creates a range to 20 (..20) to decide if the Determined Value is valid.

seg-source.mrk: System uses the Upper Limit an ignores the Expected Value; then creates a range to 20 (..20) to decide if the Determined Value is valid.

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: If an open Upper/Lower Limit range is used and Use Without Expected Value = Yes, negative Determined Values are also valid.

seg-source.mrk: If an open Upper/Lower Limit range is used and Use Without Expected Value = Yes, negative Determined Values are also valid.

trans-unit.source: Miscellaneous FastTab

seg-source.mrk: Miscellaneous FastTab

trans-unit.source: The fields on the Miscellaneous FastTab contain test plan modification information. These values are automatically determined based on the current date and the active User ID and are non-editable.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on the Miscellaneous FastTab contain test plan modification information.
These values are automatically determined based on the current date and the active User ID and are non-editable.

trans-unit.source: Home Tab

seg-source.mrk: Home Tab

trans-unit.source: The Home tab contains five processes and two reports; each is described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The Home tab contains five processes and two reports; each is described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Process / Report

seg-source.mrk: Process / Report

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Copy Test Plan

seg-source.mrk: Copy Test Plan

trans-unit.source: Copies all Test Property Sets and criteria of an existing Test Plan to a new Test Plan.

seg-source.mrk: Copies all Test Property Sets and criteria of an existing Test Plan to a new Test Plan.

trans-unit.source: Create New Version

seg-source.mrk: Create New Version

trans-unit.source: Creates a new version of an existing Test Plan version (same Test Plan number, new version).

seg-source.mrk: Creates a new version of an existing Test Plan version (same Test Plan number, new version).

trans-unit.source: Show External Document

seg-source.mrk: Show External Document

trans-unit.source: Opens the external document that was entered in the External Document Path field on the General FastTab.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the external document that was entered in the External Document Path field on the General FastTab.

trans-unit.source: Internal Comments / External Comments

seg-source.mrk: Internal Comments / External Comments

trans-unit.source: Comments can be used to add notes and remarks about a test plan.

seg-source.mrk: Comments can be used to add notes and remarks about a test plan.

trans-unit.source: Internal comments are printed on documents that will not leave the company such as test plans.

seg-source.mrk: Internal comments are printed on documents that will not leave the company such as test plans.

trans-unit.source: External comments will appear on documents that can be sent to the customer or vendor.

seg-source.mrk: External comments will appear on documents that can be sent to the customer or vendor.

trans-unit.source: Activities

seg-source.mrk: Activities

trans-unit.source: Opens the Test Plan Activities page, which is used for the Test Order Scheduling process (refer to topic “Test Order Scheduling” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: Opens the Test Plan Activities page, which is used for the Test Order Scheduling process (refer to topic “Test Order Scheduling” on page 1).

trans-unit.source: Test Plan Activities define how much time is required for the test process and links the times to resources and manufacturing capacity. Activities added to a Test Plan can be then assigned to one or more Test Plan Property Set lines.

seg-source.mrk: Test Plan Activities define how much time is required for the test process and links the times to resources and manufacturing capacity.
Activities added to a Test Plan can be then assigned to one or more Test Plan Property Set lines.
